meanings.definition: Strange or mysterious in an unsettling way.
meanings.sent1: The old house on the hill looked even uncannier in the moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The fog made the forest feel uncannier than usual.
meanings.sent3: The uncannier shadows seemed to dance in the flickering candlelight.
meanings.sent4: Her uncannier ability to predict the future amazed everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The uncannier sound of footsteps echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: More strange or mysterious in an unsettling way.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned amusement park was even uncannier than the rumors suggested.
meanings.sent2: As the night grew darker, the forest became uncannier and uncannier.
meanings.sent3: The uncannier noises coming from the attic turned out to be just a family of raccoons.
meanings.sent4: The uncannier events of the night left everyone feeling uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The uncannier presence in the room sent shivers down her spine.
